subject: Photography
title: Building a Personal Color Style
description: A quick, practical guide to Building a Personal Color Style.

hook.text: Scroll through your favorite photographer's feed. You'll notice a signature palette â€” that's their color style.

buildup.text: A consistent color style helps viewers recognize your work instantly. It becomes part of your artistic identity.

discovery.text: Developing a style takes time. Experiment with palettes, study films and paintings, and edit hundreds of images.

twist.text: Copying another photographer's preset won't give you their style. Style comes from vision, not from sliders.

climax.text: Your color style emerges when you stop asking 'what looks trendy' and start asking 'what feels like me?'

punchline.text: Your palette is your fingerprint. Make it yours.

quiz.question: How does a personal color style develop?
options: Through experimentation, study, and finding what resonates with your artistic vision
By only using one color in every photo
